name: Divided section
description: The divided section pattern is used to separate related content into distinct steps or items within a single section. Each item is visually divided using a muted [Rule](/divided-section#anatomy) and shallow padding, helping users distinguish between content blocks while maintaining a cohesive layout.
usage:
The divided section pattern provides a flexible layout for presenting grouped content that needs clear internal separation, such as steps, stages, or sequential elements. Each [Divided block](/divided-section#anatomy) is separated by a muted [Rule](/divided-section#anatomy) and shallow padding, creating visual structure without introducing strong section breaks.

The pattern can accommodate a wide range of content types, including text, images, videos, lists, code blocks, logos, and call-to-action elements. Both the section description area and the [Divided block](/divided-section#anatomy)s themselves support these content types.

Internally, the divided section reuses content blocks from the [Basic section](/basic-section) pattern. As a result, most layout configurations and content options behave identically to those in [Basic section](/basic-section), ensuring consistency and reducing the need for additional configuration or learning.

### **Supported UI blocks for the** **[Content area](/divided-section#anatomy)**

1.  **Description / body text** - Use for long-form descriptions or explanations, when full sentences and paragraphs work best.
2.  **Image** - Include a 3:2 or 16:9 ratio image to illustrate or enhance the content including: photography, isometric illustrations, diagrams, and similar visuals. The image can include an optional caption.
3.  **Video** - Embed and link video content in 16:9 ratio.
4.  **[List](/list)** - List up to 10 items, with bullet type options including: none, bullet, status, or number.
5.  **Code block** - Display preformatted code.
6.  **[Logo block](/logo-block)** - Display related logos such as customers or partners.
7.  **[Linked logo block](/linked-logo-block)** - Display logos that link to additional resources.
8.  **[CTA block](/cta-block)** - Share one or more call-to-action elements, including a primary button, secondary button, and link.
9.  **[Notification](/notification)** - Highlight alerts, updates, or contextual messages within the section.

### **When to use**

*   When content needs to be broken into clear steps or distinct items within a single section
*   When a subtle visual separation is needed without creating fully independent sections

### **When not to use**

*   When images, lists, or other content need to stand alone without internal dividers, use [Basic section](/basic-section) instead
*   When the content consists of text only, use a [Tiered list](/tiered-list) instead
*   When the content is made up of short text and a single representative image, consider using [Equal heights](/equal-heights) instead

table.name: Rule
table.description: The rule component indicates the beginning of a new section.

table.name: Heading
table.description: The section heading communicates the primary subject or theme of the section.

table.name: Description block
table.description: The description provides introductory context for the divided section. It appears at the top of the section and helps users understand the purpose or scope of the content before engaging with the divided blocks.

table.name: Divided block
table.description: The divided block represents a single step or content item within the section. Each block is visually separated by a muted rule and shallow padding, creating clear distinction between items while maintaining a cohesive flow.

table.name: Block rule
table.description: The rule component indicates the beginning of a new block item.

table.name: Block heading
table.description: The block heading identifies the focus of each [Divided block](wiki-ref://grid-YfHOdsWGM_/i-DUwUcIMqO2).

table.name: Content area
table.description: The content area contains the main content for each [Divided block](wiki-ref://grid-YfHOdsWGM_/i-DUwUcIMqO2). It supports the same content types and layout options as the [Basic section](wiki-ref://grid-ymtdOF6n4R/i-vpN6ETB7hS) pattern, including text, images, videos, lists, code blocks, logos, and CTA block.

properties.name: Section rule
properties.description: The rule component indicates the beginning of a new pattern
properties.constraint: Only use the default style for the section-level rule

properties.name: Medium layout
properties.description: Indicate layout for medium size

properties.name: Heading
properties.description: 4-column width heading using H2

properties.name: Linked heading
properties.description: The heading can be used as a link when paired with a chevron(›) and a clear indication.

properties.name: Body
properties.description: 4-column width body text

properties.name: Divided block heading
properties.description: 4-column width H5 heading for each divided block item

properties.name: Block heading bullet style
properties.description: The block heading bullet style defines how the block heading is visually presented within each divided block. When the bullet option is used, an additional 32px indent is applied to the content area below the heading to align the content visually with the bullet marker.

properties.name: Block rule
properties.description: The rule component to separate each  block

properties.name: Block bottom padding
properties.description: The type of padding applied to the block
properties.constraint: The last block of the pattern must not have bottom padding.

properties.name: Bottom padding
properties.description: The type of padding applied to the bottom of the pattern

properties.name: Image
properties.description: The container for placing visual content such as images, illustrations, or diagrams.

properties.name: Image aspect ratio
properties.description: Indicate ratio of the image

properties.name: Image aspect ratio
properties.description: Indicate ratio of the image

properties.name: Image responsive aspect ratio
properties.description: Change the aspect ratio of an image container, depending on the screen size

properties.name: Image caption
properties.description: Optional HTML caption below the image

properties.name: Link CTA
properties.description: The text link used for contextual actions or pathways to more information. It uses a chevron (›) to indicate navigation to additional content or pages.

properties.name: Primary CTA
properties.description: The CTA used with the positive button style. It indicates a high-priority, positive action and is reserved for hero areas or other key call-to-action sections.

properties.name: Secondary CTA
properties.description: The CTA using the default button style. It is used for most actions that are positive but not primary, and may serve as the main CTA in non-hero sections.

properties.name: Text
properties.description: The code that is being shown inside of the code component.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: What semantic type the notification is.

properties.name: Border
properties.description: Wether the notification has a border or not. Borderless notifications are used for example in [Table](wiki-ref://grid-ymtdOF6n4R/i-aUPUyjNgjD).

properties.name: Inline
properties.description: Wether the title and description of the notification are being shown in one line. reduces the overall height of the notification allowing it to be used where space is at a premium.

properties.name: Title
properties.description: Sets the content of the title.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: Sets the content of the description.

properties.name: Dismissible
properties.description: Wether or not the notification can be dismissed. If it can be dismissed the dismiss button is being shown.

properties.name: Actions
properties.description: Allows to give associated actions with the notification.

properties.name: Time stamp
properties.description: Can be set to the timestamp when the event when that triggered the notification took place.

properties.name: Logo block
properties.description: The logo block showcases a group of related images, such as a group of customer or partner logos.

Up to 10 logos

properties.description: 16:9 image container with the logo image inside

properties.name: List item text

properties.name: List
